results.title: A Bridge too far
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Richard Levine, Joseph E, John Palmer, Joseph E. Levine and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This World War II film is action packed with a renown cast. The film vividly recreates in stunning detail, a controversial episode in military history known as Operation Market Garden. This involved the drop of 35,000 American and British paratroopers into Holland to secure the six major bridges leading to the German border. Sir Richard Attenborough’s direction of this wartime epic is flawless and the film is filled with compelling and unforgettable imagery such as the parachute drop. The vividness and brutality of war, along with the courage and daring of the people involved are emphasised in this production.

results.title: 84 Charing Cross Road
results.creator_credit: David Jones, Geoffrey Helman and Brooksfilms
results.brief_description: Feisty Helen Hanff (Anne Bancroft) just loves rare books, the sort you can’t get in New York. Little does she know that a letter to a small second-hand bookshop in London will lead to a twenty year love affair with the staff and the city. Helen strikes up a particularly affectionate correspondence with Frank Doel (Anthony Hopkins) at Marks & Co. in ‘84 Charing Cross Road. Her letters are soon followed by food parcels to the food-rationed staff, and insights into life across the Atlantic. A heartwarming, charming film based upon the memoirs of Helen Hanff and the play adapted from her book.

results.title: 36 Fillette
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Valerie Seydoux, Emmanuel Schlumberger and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The title refers to a child’s dress size, which the film’s heroine, Lili, has unmistakably outgrown. A sullen, uncommunicative 14 year old vacationing with her family in Biarritz, Lili is clearly ready to strike out on her own. She does so by dressing up in jeans, a corset and a raincoat, then hitching a ride to the local nightclub in search of adventure. Not surprisingly, adventure comes her way! “36 Fillette”, written and directed by French novelist Catherine Breillat, is based on one of her novels.

results.title: 23 Skidoo
results.brief_description: If you erase the people of downtown America, the effect is bizarre, not to say disturbing. That is what this film does. It shows the familiar urban scene without a soul in sight; streets empty, buildings empty, yet everywhere there is evidence of recent life and activity. At the end of the film we learn what has happened. Awards: London; Cracow; Salerno.

results.title: 21-87 (D)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Arthur Lipsett
results.brief_description: A wry comment on the machine-dominated man, the man to whom nothing matters, who waits on chance for his number to come up. An experimental film presenting a succession of many unrelated views of passing crowds - church, in the street, in the circus. The effect is chaotic, but true to life. (Awards: Chicago, Ann Arbor, Palo Alta.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Arthur Lipsett

results.brief_description: The greatest space epic of all time reaches its unforgettable conclusion in 2010 - the year we make contact. While the Earth poises on the brink of nuclear self-destruction, a team of Russian amd American scientists, headed by Roy Scheider and Helen Mirren hurtle to a rendezvous with the abandoned Discovery spacecraft and its sole known survivor, the homicidal computer HAL. Their mission is to ‘awake’ HAL and unravel the puzzling skein of events that culminated in astronaut Dave Bowman’s last transmission, “My God, it’s full of stars!” seen at the end of 2001. This is an emotionally moving thriller in which the human drama takes its rightful place alongside the movie’s visual magic.

results.creator_credit: Ernest Thompson, Bill Badalato, Daniel Grodnik and Atlantic Productions
results.brief_description: It was the end of high school and nearing the end of an era when teenage friends Scott (Kiefer Sutherland) and Ralph (Robert Downey Jr) face the full brunt of events in society at the time - the war in Vietnam, Neil Armstrong walking on the moon, and a boom in hippie culture. Scott, a pacifist, has a brother in Vietnam and clashes with his father over his views. Ralph seems to be avoiding the issue through drugs - much to the chagrin of Scott, and Scott’s younger sister, Beth (Winona Ryder), who takes on a bigger role in their lives. In the space of one Summer, two families are drawn together by love, death and war, changing their relationship to one another and society irrevocably. Features a soundtrack of classic 60’s music. Cast also includes Bruce Dern and Mariette Hartley.

results.title: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Bob Scarfe, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions

video_links.name: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years

results.brief_description: An education officer from the Museum of Victoria looks at a number of “labour saving appliances” used in the home over the last one hundred and fifty years and looks at the development of laundry and kitchen appliances.

results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, Julie Sheehan, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Pat Walter, a video camera operator, Julie Copeland, a radio broadcaster and producer, and Lina Caneva, a TV and radio journalist, discuss their experiences as women working in the male-dominated TV and radio industry.
